io.flic.fliclib.javaclient

Class ScanWizard

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.flic.fliclib.javaclient.ScanWizard

  • public abstract class ScanWizard
extends java.lang.Object
    Scan wizard class. This class will scan for a new button and pair it automatically. There are internal timeouts that make sure operations don't take too long time. Inherit this class and override the methods. Then add this scan wizard to a FlicClient using FlicClient.addScanWizard(ScanWizard) to start it. You can cancel by calling FlicClient.cancelScanWizard(ScanWizard).

    • Method Detail

      • onFoundPrivateButton

        public abstract void onFoundPrivateButton()
                                   throws java.io.IOException
        This will be called once if a private button is found. Tell the user to hold down the button for 7 seconds in order to make it public.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • onFoundPublicButton

        public abstract void onFoundPublicButton(Bdaddr bdaddr,
                       java.lang.String name)
                                  throws java.io.IOException
        This will be called once a public button is found. Now a connection attempt will be made to the device in order to pair and verify it.
        Parameters:
        bdaddr - Bluetooth Device Address
        name - Advertising name
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • onButtonConnected

        public abstract void onButtonConnected(Bdaddr bdaddr,
                     java.lang.String name)
                                throws java.io.IOException
        This will be called once the bluetooth connection has been established. Now a pair attempt will be made.
        Parameters:
        bdaddr - Bluetooth Device Address
        name - Advertising name
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • onCompleted

        public abstract void onCompleted(ScanWizardResult result,
               Bdaddr bdaddr,
               java.lang.String name)
                          throws java.io.IOException
        Scan wizard completed. If the result is success, you can now create a connection channel to the button. The ScanWizard is now detached from the FlicClient and can now be recycled.
        Parameters:
        result - Result of the scan wizard
        bdaddr - Bluetooth Device Address or null, depending on if onFoundPublicButton(io.flic.fliclib.javaclient.Bdaddr, java.lang.String) has been called or not
        name - Advertising name or null, depending on if onFoundPublicButton(io.flic.fliclib.javaclient.Bdaddr, java.lang.String) has been called or not
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
